data.Sentence_cn: 五磅也太贵
data.Sentence: --- lesson 28  Five pounds too dear

data.Sentence_cn: 当一艘大型班船进港的时候，许多小船载着各种杂货快速向客轮驶来。
data.Sentence: Small boats loaded with wares sped to the great liner as she was entering the harbour.

data.Sentence_cn: 大船还未下锚。小船上的人就纷纷爬上客轮。
data.Sentence: Before she had anchored, the men from the boats had climbed on board

data.Sentence_cn: 一会儿工夫，甲板上就摆满了色彩斑斓的波斯地毯。印度丝绸。铜咖啡壶以及手工制作的漂亮的银器。
data.Sentence: and the decks were soon covered with colourful rugs from Persia, silks from India, copper coffee pots, and beautiful handmade silverware.

data.Sentence_cn: 要想不为这些东西所动心是很困难的。
data.Sentence: It was difficult not to be tempted.

data.Sentence_cn: 船上的许多游客开始同商贩讨价还价起来，
data.Sentence: Many of the tourists on board had begun bargaining with the tradesmen,

data.Sentence_cn: 但我打定主意上岸之前什么也不买。
data.Sentence: but I decide not to buy anything until I had disembarked.

data.Sentence_cn: 我刚下船，就被一个人截住，他向我兜售一枚钻石戒指。
data.Sentence: I had no sooner got off the ship than I was assailed by a man who wanted to sell me a diamond ring.

data.Sentence_cn: 我根本不想买，但我不能掩饰这样一个事实：其钻石之大给我留下了深刻的印象。
data.Sentence: I had no intention of buying one, but I could not conceal the fact that I was impressed by the size of the diamonds.

data.Sentence_cn: 有的钻石像玻璃球那么大。
data.Sentence: Some of them were as big as marbles.

data.Sentence_cn: 那人竭力想证明那钻石是真货。
data.Sentence: The man went to great lengths to prove that the diamonds were real.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们路过一家商店时，他将一颗钻石使劲地往橱窗上一按，在玻璃上留下一道深痕。
data.Sentence: As we were walking past a shop, he held a diamond firmly against the window and made a deep impression in the glass.

data.Sentence_cn: 我花了半个多小时才摆脱了他的纠缠。
data.Sentence: It took me over half an hour to get rid of him.

data.Sentence_cn: 向我兜售的第二个人是卖名贵钢笔和手表的。
data.Sentence: The next man to approach me was selling expensive pens and watches.

data.Sentence_cn: 我仔细察看了一枝钢笔，
data.Sentence: I examined one of the pens closely.

data.Sentence_cn: 那看上去确实不假，
data.Sentence: It certainly looked genuine.

data.Sentence_cn: 金笔帽下方整齐地刻有“美国制造”字样。
data.Sentence: At the base of the gold cap, the words 'made in the U.S.A' had been neatly inscribed.

data.Sentence_cn: 那人说那支笔值50英镑，作为特别优惠，他愿意让我出30英镑成交。
data.Sentence: The man said that the pen was worth £50, but as a special favour, he would let me have it for £30.

data.Sentence_cn: 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我只愿出5镑钱。
data.Sentence: I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay £5.

data.Sentence_cn: 那人激动地打着手势，仿佛我的出价使他不能容忍。但他终于把价钱降到了10英镑。
data.Sentence: Gesticulating wildly, the man acted as if he found my offer outrageous, but he eventually reduced the price to £10.

data.Sentence_cn: 我耸耸肩膀掉头走开了。一会儿，他突然从后追了上来，把笔塞到我手里。
data.Sentence: Shrugging my shoulders, I began to walk away when, a moment later, he ran after me and thrust the pen into my hands.

data.Sentence_cn: 虽然他绝望地举起双手，但他毫不迟疑地收下了我付给他的5镑钱。
data.Sentence: Though he kept throwing up his arms in despair, he readily accepted the £5 I give him.

data.Sentence_cn: 在回到船上之前，我一直为我的绝妙的讨价还价而洋洋得意。
data.Sentence: I felt especially pleased with my wonderful bargain -- until I got back to the ship.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而不管我如何摆弄，那枝漂亮的钢笔就是吸不进墨水来。直到今天，那枝笔连一个字也没写过！
data.Sentence: No matter how hard I tried, it was impossible to fill this beautiful pen with ink and to this day it has never written a single word!
